items.title: Rad Power’s Haul-o-ween Sale offers up to $210 in FREE cargo or starter gear with new and legacy e-bikes starting from $1,399
items.summary:
Rad Power Bikes has launched its Haul-o-ween Sale, with a $200 discount on its RadRover 6 Plus e-bike, as well as several other models (new and legacy) getting up to $210 in FREE bundle kits and accessories. Amongst the models seeing bundles attached, you’ll find the Radster Trail Off-Road e-bike getting a free $199 cargo kit at $1,999 shipped, with its Radster Road Commuter e-bike sibling getting the same kit for $1,999 shipped too. Just be sure to add the e-bikes and the cargo kits (all from the same landing pages) to your cart for the discount to automatically be applied. Originally going for $2,199 at full price since their release in March, we saw the brand officially drop prices to these rates mid-August, with the deals here giving you the continued lowest tracked prices alongside the free gear. Head below to learn more and browse the full lineup of deals while the sale lasts.

items.summary:
Amazon is now offering its best pricing ever on the LEGO Ideas Hocus Pocus – The Sanderson Sister’s Cottage set at $183.98 shipped. Normally priced at $230, especially directly from LEGO’s website, where discounts are extremely rare, we’ve only seen it go as low as $195 here at Amazon before today. Now, you can score a larger-than-ever $46 markdown that drops things to a new all-time low, with the discount coming at an opportune time for folks prepping for end-of-the-month Halloween fun.

more…

items.title: Anthropic hires former Stripe CTO Rahul Patil as its new CTO, taking over from co-founder Sam McCandlish, who will move to a new role as chief architect (Russell Brandom/TechCrunch)
items.summary:
Russell Brandom / TechCrunch:
Anthropic hires former Stripe CTO Rahul Patil as its new CTO, taking over from co-founder Sam McCandlish, who will move to a new role as chief architect  —  Anthropic has a new chief technical officer, former Stripe CTO Rahul Patil.  Patil started at the company earlier this week …

items.title: This versatile aluminum laptop stand folds down to a compact size when not in use, now $25 (Reg. $35)
items.summary:
OMOTON Aluminum Rotating Laptop Stand

Buy for $25 (Reg. $35)

What we love

Bolster ergonomics at home and when traveling with this collapsible laptop stand. When unfolded, it can elevate an up to 16-inch laptop, and the stand itself can fully rotate. This is a feature I could see coming in handy when meeting clients. I love that it’s made of aluminum, which should give it a much more premium look and feel when compared to plastic counterparts.

items.title: Skip the subscription and own Microsoft Office and Windows 11 Pro, now $45 (Reg. $419)
items.summary:
If you’re tired of monthly software fees and ready for something permanent, this deal makes a lot of sense. Instead of paying for Microsoft 365 every month, you can get a lifetime license for Microsoft Office Professional 2021 and pair it with a full upgrade to Windows 11 Pro, all for just $44.97 (Reg. $418.99) during Deal Days. That’s a huge discount from the regular price, and it covers two of the most essential software tools for any PC user.

JMIERR Henley Ribbed V-Neck Shirt

What we love

Back in March of this year I picked up a few colorways of this exact shirt and I absolutely love all of them. In fact, I liked this style so much that I have since purchased more colorways. Despite the fact that I spent more than today’s deal, I still have zero regrets. That should tell you just how much I like them.

items.title: Keychron’s OnePlus 81 Pro metal keyboard hits new $110 low ahead of fall Prime Day (50% off)
items.summary:
As part of its wider sale on keychron keyboards, Woot is offering the OnePlus 81 Pro mechanical keyboard for $109.99 Prime shipped (a $6 delivery fee will apply otherwise). Originally priced at $220, this particular model is now down 50%, saving you $110. That puts it $10 under its previous all-time low and our mention, making this the best price we’ve tracked yet. For comparison, the same model is currently listed at $170 on Keychron’s own site, while the Q1 Pro it’s based on is going for $168 at Amazon. Head below for more details along with deals on other Keychron boards.

If you are looking for an affordable way to tote your laptop to and from work, school, and the like, it’s hard to go wrong here.
